item.title: Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault Is Discounted On PC
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Digital Sun's Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault launched in early access for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S on November 19. The PC version of the highly anticipated Zelda-inspired roguelike is already seeing a nice discount over on Fanatical. You can pick it up for $20.09, saving you nearly $10 off the $30 launch price. This is the lowest price for the game so far, as Steam is offering the game for $24.89. Note that buying the game at Fanatical gets you an official Steam key.

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault

$20 (was $30)

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault is the follow-up to the original Moonlighter, which launched in 2018, and offers the same mix of cozy shop sim and action-Roguelike gameplay its predecessor is known for. This time, however, you traverse its regions in a 3D isometric perspective, instead of the top-down 2D view of the first game. The new visual style and new gameplay mechanics also come with expanded accessibility options compared to the original.

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault may be on sale on Steam through Fanatical, but it launched on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S as well, where it's available day one if you're an Xbox GamePass subscriber.

The original Moonlighter came out in May 2018 to critical acclaim, and if you're a fan of 16-bit retro art styles, then this is the game for you. Fanatical also has the original on sale if you're curious about checking out the series' roots. It's currently down to $14.69 (was $20) for the PC version.

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault isn't the only game on sale through Fanatical. If you're on the hunt for discounts on recent releases, you can grab the chill cycling sim Wheel World for just $12 (was $19.99), and the gorgeous co-op puzzle game LEGO Voyagers is currently sitting at $16.24 (was $25). Preorders for select upcoming titles are discounted ahead of their releases early next year, including Resident Evil Requiem for $57.39 (normally $70), Nioh 3 for $61.59 (was $70), and Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection, which is down to $57.39 (normally $70).

More Game Deals at Fanatical

  • LEGO Voyagers -- $16.24 ($25)
  • Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection -- $57.39 ($70) | Releases March 12, 2026
  • Nioh 3 -- $61.59 ($70) | Releases February 5, 2026
  • Resident Evil Requiem -- $57.39 ($70) | Releases February 27, 2026
  • Wheel World -- $12 ($20)
  • Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (Releases February 12, 2026) -- $52.79 ($60)

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

item.title: Marvel Cosmic Invasion Getting A Physical Deluxe Edition Next Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Marvel Cosmic Invasion launches digitally on PC and console next month, but those holding out for a physical release will need to hold out a bit longer. The PS5, Xbox Series X, Switch 2, and Switch physical editions of the game launch on March 13, 2026, but the upshot is that fans can preorder the game now at Best Buy and GameStop. While there are no preorder bonuses announced, you can secure copies of the $40 Standard Edition (or $50 on Switch 2) and $60 Deluxe Edition (or $70 on Switch 2), with the latter including extra content like a steelbook case, a poster, art cards, and a sticker sheet. Walmart is also listing preorders, but all versions are currently sold out, so we recommend preordering at one of the other retailers soon in case it sells out there as well.

Marvel Cosmic Invasion Deluxe Edition

$60 | Releases March 13, 2026

The Deluxe Edition of Marvel Cosmic Invasion includes the full game and a selection of physical collectibles. Here's a rundown of everything included:

  • Marvel Cosmic Invasion base game
  • Steelbook case
  • 15 premium art cards
  • Poster
  • Two sticker sheets
  • Deluxe Edition Box

Marvel Cosmic Invasion Deluxe Edition is available on PS5, Xbox Series X, Switch 2, and Switch. Note that the Switch 2 version costs $70, which is $10 more than on the other platforms, but it includes the full game on the cartridge, which is rare among third-party Switch 2 releases that opt for a Game Key-Card format instead.

Marvel Cosmic Invasion Deluxe Edition Preorders

  • PS5 -- $60 | Also at GameStop
  • Xbox Series X -- $60 | Also at GameStop
  • Switch 2 -- $70 | Also at GameStop
  • Switch -- $60 | Also at GameStop

A beat-’em-up game from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge developer Tribute Games, Marvel Cosmic Invasion sees Earth’s Mightiest Mortals team up to take on Annihilus and his Annihilation Wave. Designed to look like an old-school SNES action game with its pixel-art graphics, the game features a roster of 15 heroes. The lineup includes popular characters like Captain America, Storm, and Spider-Man, alongside more obscure heroes like Beta Ray Bill and Quasar, all rendered in a style that evokes classic ’90s video games.

item.title: Avowed's Fall Update Has Been Pushed To 2026, Will Now Include More Content
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Obsidian has announced that the planned fall update for Avowed is not going to make it on time. The features planned for the update are still coming, but they are now going to be wrapped into a "larger update" instead in February 2026 to celebrate the game's first anniversary.

"This update will include everything originally planned for fall, plus additional features that will make it our biggest update yet. Stay tuned as we head into the new year for more details on what’s planned for the Living Lands," the developer said.

Avowed previously got spring and summer updates that added things like a no-spiders mode and custom map markers. The February 2026 update will include New Game Plus and Photo modes, along with a new weapon type, new character presets, more Godlike feature presets, and the ability to change your character's appearance, among other things.

Avowed launched in February 2025 for PC and Xbox Series X|S, and GameSpot's Avowed review scored it a 6/10. "Avowed's impactful and satisfying combat is undone by a widely unbalanced upgrade system and an uninteresting story that wastes its potential," reviewer Alessandro Barbosa said.

Like all of Microsoft's other games, Avowed is available with Xbox Game Pass. The game's director, Carrie Patel, said she was interested in making more Avowed, but no sequel has been announced as of yet and Patel has since left Obsidian.

Avowed was originally pitched as a multiplayer-centric game that married Destiny with Skyrim. That was before Patel came on board as the game's director and helped lead the project through a major development pivot.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Red Dead Redemption's New Version Launched With A Big Issue On Xbox
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Rockstar Games launched the new version of Red Dead Redemption on modern consoles and mobile today, December 2, but the rollout did not go entirely smoothly on Xbox.

People who already own Red Dead Redemption for Xbox 360 digitally were expecting the new edition for Xbox Series X|S to automatically show up as a free download, but quickly noticed this didn't happen.

This is an issue that Rockstar is aware of and the studio is working with Microsoft to resolve it. "Thank you for your patience," Rockstar said.

The new version of Red Dead Redemption supports higher frame rates, HDR support, and resolutions up to 4K for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S. The Switch 2 edition, meanwhile, supports DLSS, HDR, and mouse controls.

Developers Double Eleven and Cast Iron Games created the new versions of Red Dead Redemption for console in collaboration with Rockstar Games. Red Dead Redemption is also available now for iOS and Android for the first time as part of a collaboration with Netflix. All subscribers get it for free.

December 2 also marked the day that Red Dead Redemption arrived on PlayStation Plus. GTA+ subscribers can also get the new version of the game as part of their membership.

In addition to this new version of Red Dead Redemption, Rockstar is rumored to be working on new versions of Red Dead Redemption 2 for modern consoles. For more, check out all the best Red Dead Redemption 2 mods in the gallery below.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Players Can Now Get Mewtwo
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Pokemon Company is giving away another freebie for Pokemon Legends: Z-A. Players can now claim two free Mega Stones for Mewtwo, which will unlock a side quest to catch the legendary Pokemon.

The two Mega Stones--Mewtwonite X and Mewtwonite Y--can be downloaded via the Mystery Gift function. Once equipped, they allow the legendary Pokemon to Mega Evolve into Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, respectively.

To claim the Mega Stones, you must fire up your copy of Pokemon Legends: Z-A and do the following:

  1. Press X to open the menu
  2. Select Link Play
  3. Select Mystery Gift
  4. Choose Get via Internet and download the Mega Stones
  5. Save your game

Mewtwo isn't normally available in Pokemon Legends: Z-A, but you'll have a chance to catch one after receiving these Mega Stones. Once you've cleared the main story and claimed the new Mystery Gift, travel to Lysandre Cafe to undertake a new side mission, which will involve exploring Lysandre Labs where you'll encounter the legendary Pokemon.

Mewtwo is the second legendary to be added to the game via Mystery Gift. Players can also claim a free Diancite, which unlocks a quest to catch the mythical Pokemon Diancie. As with Mewtwo, you'll need to have completed the main story before you can undertake Diancie's side quest.

Even more new Mega Evolutions are coming as part of Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Mega Dimension DLC, which launches on December 10. The latest trailer for the expansion revealed another new Mega-Evolved form for Lucario: Mega Lucario Z. This form is the game's first Z Mega Evolution, which has a quicker cooldown period but depletes Mega Power faster than a standard Mega Evolution.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
